_header: The double sorrow of Troilus to tellen
Note: For further extracts appearing as separate poems, see 1398, 2370, 2379, 3146, 4085.
Subjects: romances; Troilus and Cressida, story of
_description: Extracts from Geoffrey Chaucer, Troilus and Criseyde — rhyme royal stanzas

BodLauMis99.Note:
One stanza, ‘Cantus Troili’ (1.400-6), in an English
                    prose treatise, Disce Mori.

OxfJesus39.First Lines:
…If no loue is O god what fele I soAnd if loue is what
                    þinge and whiche is he…
OxfJesus39.Last Lines:
…That from it cometh may me sauoury þenkeffor ay thrust I
                    þe more þat I it drynke…
OxfJesus39.Note:
One stanza, ‘Cantus Troili’ (1.400-6), in an English
                    prose treatise, Disce Mori.
OxfJesus39.Editions:
Wager,  Willis J. 
             “‘Fleshly Love’ in Chaucer’s Troilus.” 
             Modern Language Review
         34 (1939): 62-6: 62.

CULGg412.First Lines:
…If Love be not o Lord What fele I soIf Love be what thyng
                    and whiche is he…
CULGg412.Last Lines:
…That comyth of hym may to me savery thynkefor als thirst I
                    the more I yt drynke
CULGg412.Note:
One stanza, ‘Cantus Troili’: 1.400-6; folio formerly
                    numbered 105v.

CamTCC600.First Lines:
…A whestone is no kerving instrumentAnd yitte it makeþe
                    sharp kerving toolisIf þou wost ought where þat I haue
                    miswentEschuwe þou þat for suche thing to þee scoole
                    is…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…If þowe do so þy witte is wele bewaredBy his
                    contrarie is every thing declared
CamTCC600.Note:
One stanza: 1.631-37; after it, ‘Qui servit nequam mercedem non
                        capit equam / Omnia qui querit perdere dignus erit’.
CamTCC600.Editions:

CamTCC652.First Lines:
…O sade tonge so often here byforehas þu made mony oon
                    bryghte of hewe…
CamTCC652.Last Lines:
…No wonder is so god me sende heleÞoghe wymmen drede with
                    vs men to dele…

DULCosViii11.Transcription:
…So fer forþ am I broght in louys daunceThat endles I hop
                    all way a bovt…
